title: Requires certain reporting requirements from the division of minority and women's business development as well as from the authority
summary: Requires certain reporting requirements from the division of minority and women's business development as well as from the authority.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1066

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. ORTIZ -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. CASTELLI
         -- read once and referred to the Committee on Governmental Operations

       AN ACT to amend the economic development law, in relation  to  reporting
         requirements of the division of minority and women's business develop-
         ment

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 118 of the economic development law is  amended  by
    2  adding a new subdivision 11 to read as follows:
    3    11. REPORT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS TO THE GOVERNOR, THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT
    4  OF THE SENATE, AND THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY THE NUMBER AND PERCENTAGE
    5  OF  MINORITY  AND  WOMEN-OWNED  BUSINESS ENTERPRISES EMPLOYED WITHIN THE
    6  STATE AND THE NUMBER AND PERCENTAGE RECEIVING EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS WITH-
    7  IN THE STATE AND STATE  CONTRACTS  PURSUANT  TO  SECTION  THREE  HUNDRED
    8  TWELVE  OF  THE  EXECUTIVE  LAW.  THIS REPORTING REQUIREMENT SHALL BE IN
    9  ADDITION TO THE ADVISORY REQUIREMENTS CONFERRED UPON THE ADVISORY  BOARD
   10  SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISION SIX OF SECTION ONE HUNDRED TWENTY OF THIS ARTI-
   11  CLE.
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03699-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the economic development law, in relation to reporting requirements of the division of minority and women's business development
